results.abstract: Congratulates US on Lt Col Glenn 3-orbit space flight, lr to Pres Kennedy; urges US and USSR cooperate in space exploration

headline.main: PREMIER CORDIAL; Hails Glenn's Flight and Asks Science Be Used for Peace

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: INTERNATIONAL (JOINT) MOVES TO CONTROL AND EXPLORE SPACE

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Feb, 21 Premier Khrushchev called on the United States today to join its efforts with those of the Soviet Union in the conquest of space.

byline.original: By THEODORE SHABAD Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Feb, 21 Premier Khrushchev called on the United States today to join its efforts with those of the Soviet Union in the conquest of space.

results.abstract: Glenn's family, parents and in-laws fly to Palm Beach with Kennedy aboard Pres plane, then on to Canaveral to meet Glenn; illus; Glenn feels flight estab that human can replace much automated equipment in space craft; implications discussed; Vice Pres Johnson to fly to Grand Turk Is to escort Glenn; need for human initiative and judgment in space seen exemplified by Glenn's maneuvering capsule to try to determine origin of mysterious bright particles around craft each sunrise

headline.main: Glenn Feels Pilot Can Replace Much of Spaceship Automation; GLENN ENHANCES ASTRONAUT ROLE

results.snippet: GRAND TURK ISLAND, B.W.I., Feb. 22 Lieut. Col. John H. Glenn Jr. believes the most significant technical result of his space flight has been to establish man's role as a pilot in space.

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEY Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: GRAND TURK ISLAND, B.W.I., Feb. 22 Lieut. Col. John H. Glenn Jr. believes the most significant technical result of his space flight has been to establish man's role as a pilot in space.

results.snippet: The Glenn flight provided important lessons for the future of the U.S. space program.
results.lead_paragraph: The Glenn flight provided important lessons for the future of the U.S. space program.

headline.main: Race in Space; Rockets and Men

results.snippet: "We are behind," President Kennedy said after Russia's Yuri Gagarin orbited the earth last April, "and it will be some time before we catch up."
results.lead_paragraph: "We are behind," President Kennedy said after Russia's Yuri Gagarin orbited the earth last April, "and it will be some time before we catch up."
